**Diagnosis:**

- Vaso-occlusive crisis (bone pain, dactylitis)
- Hemolytic anemia (jaundice, elevated bilirubin, reticulocytosis)
- Sickle cells on peripheral smear
- Age-appropriate presentation (symptoms typically begin after 6 months when HbF decreases)

**Differential:**
- Option 0 (Sickle cell trait): Usually asymptomatic, wouldn't cause this severe presentation
- Option 2 (Hemoglobin F): Protective, not causative
- Option 3 (HbC): Milder disease, different smear findings
